column5: Awsome stuff!  I live getting my little guys out on the water with me.

That is priceless! Thank you very much Simon et al. Just a minor thing though....it is mINnow not MYnnow.... I am so looking forward to doing that same with my son-in-law and his upcoming child in around 3 years. DV
A true outdoorsman in the making, thanx for posting, theres nothing like the great outdoors, especially where you reside

Thanks for all the kind replies gang.  I want to respond to each of you but cant get the darned multiquote thing to work.  Bly and Ryan.....i was going to call this thread "On the shoulders of giants" refering to Sidney and Averie.....i was thinking of them the whole time leading up to the moment jack got his first fish.   LOL...HTMH.....Mynnow is not a strange English accent its just what Jack has called Minnows since he decided he wanted to talk.
To multiquote simply click on multiquote in each post you wish to respond to and then click add reply at the bottom of the last post.

Priceless Simon... got a good chuckle near the end when Jack said "caught a perch.... DON'T TOUCH IT..."  Got a huge grin on my face and was the highlight for me  Great job to all Thanks for sharing Jacques
I think he was saying quick pull my finger lol Great pics

I have watched this a few times since you put it up and it always kills me when Jack is re-enacting the fishing along with you.  "reel, reel, reel... Don't touch it!"  Killer stuff man.  Thanks for sharing Simon.  Cheers,  Mark
Great video and pics Limey.

Hi all,  Jack came out in the boat with mum and me this evening. I took us to a lake that i know holds lots of perch with the hope that a bobber set up might get jack his first fish.  The lake is more of a 'puddle' by the side of the highway...but very sheltered with easy access.  Jack got his first fish ever in the boat after first losing a pike after a line stripping battle.     <iframe width="560" height="349" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/IvTlvBAEySg" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
Way to go Jack. You'll be out fishing the old man in no time.  Great photo's Simon.
Delightful! Cherish these moments, he'll be growing up too fast, they all do.
How old is the little fella?
2 years 3 months
I can't wait... My boy is only 6 weeks old and im pumped for this moment...
What a great introduction to fishing for Jack! I smiled and laughed through the whole video:clapping:

Good job Jack!! Hey Simon is that the Ipilot or the copilot? I want to get either or for my minnkota..How does it work in moderatre wind conditions? I think the copilot is the way I want to go..Cheaper.. Anyway thanks for sharing your family treasures
Way to go Jack!!  Thank you for sharing that, was laughing and cheering for him and it brought forward many memories of when my girls were younger.  Jack is adorable!  Way to go Mom and Dad!
awesome job jack! my son is about 25 months and is ready for his first fish.
Way to go Jack!  My boy (Also Jack!) will be 2 in August.  Not far behind ya   Great video is always
Congrats to Jack - And my god... I could of sworn that little guy was just born last week?!? He's getting so big - congrats dude!  Cheers, Ryan
Always enjoy your videos. This is great having video of Jacks first fish.
WOOHOO!!!  Awesome stuff!
Hey that's awesome Jack got his first fish. That pike was a good fight. Glad you shared this video of his first.
'So Dad, what happens if I put my finger in there?'
Truly a classic moment !!!!
that video just re-arranged a bad day for me.... way to go Jack.. U Da MAN !  Thanks for posting this.
Perfect
Awesome Simon - and Jack is first guy I have seen can get away with wearing a speedo A fishing partner for life there mate
Way to go Jack!!!  Maureen
That was great.  When that pike came off I swear he was thinking of the word that soooo many of us have uttered when we've lost a fish at the boat.
that's great
PRICELESS!  I was in your exact shoes 13 years ago...they grow up SO fast!!!!!!!!!!!!  Cherish what you have now...cause pretty soon, the ol' man don't know squat!!!!!!!!!

I said one of those many words when I saw it happen!  Truly a priceless moment. Congrats Jack! WTG Mom and Dad for getting him out there. A great piece of this planet you have up there, I need to move.
